intro: Mimulopsis glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular mimulopsis, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Loasaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or red. The plant has hairy, glandular leaves that help it retain moisture in arid environments. It thrives in rocky soils and is often found in desert scrub habitats. Mimulopsis glandulosa is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in its native range.
